description.en: Logic Home Control devices for Homey

hint.en: This card will trigger on a specific button and scene combination pressed.
This card will trigger on any button pressed and provides the button and scene tokens.
hint.nl: Deze kaart wordt geactiveerd bij iedere knop die ingedrukt wordt en biedt de knop en scene tokens aan.

hint.en: This card will trigger on a specific button and scene combination pressed.
This card will trigger on a specific button and scene combination pressed.

Set the "indicator LED brightness level" for a specific button. 
Range: 0 - 100 percentage of brightness.
0 = indicator LED switched OFF

Set the "indicator LED flashing conditions" for a specific button. 
Level
Range: 0 - 100 percentage of brightness.
0 = indicator LED switched OFF
On/Off period:
Range: 0.1 - 25.5 seconds
On/Off cycles:
Range: 0 - 255, 0 = off, 255 = forever
Stop the "indicator LED flashing conditions" for a specific button.

Set the "indicator LED brightness level" for a specific button. 
Range: 0 - 100 percentage of brightness.
0 = indicator LED switched OFF

Set the "indicator LED flashing conditions" for a specific button. 
Level
Range: 0 - 100 percentage of brightness.
0 = indicator LED switched OFF
On/Off period:
Range: 0.1 - 25.5 seconds
On/Off cycles:
Range: 0 - 255, 0 = off, 255 = forever
Stop the "indicator LED flashing conditions" for a specific button.

Lifeline. 
Sends Device Reset notifications, and Central Scene notifications.
Basic Report Pushbutton 1
Switch Binary Set Pushbutton 1
Switch Multilevel Set Pushbutton 1
Basic Report Pushbutton 2
Switch Binary Set Pushbutton 2
Switch Multilevel Set Pushbutton 2
Basic Report Pushbutton 3
Switch Binary Set Pushbutton 3
Switch Multilevel Set Pushbutton 3
Basic Report Pushbutton 4
Switch Binary Set Pushbutton 4
Switch Multilevel Set Pushbutton 4
Basic Report Dimmer device
Pushbutton 1 controls the dimmer
Pushbutton 2 controls the dimmer
Pushbutton 3 controls the dimmer
Pushbutton 4 controls the dimmer

This parameter specifies the duration of a full regulation of the light from 0% to 100%. A regulation of the light with 1% will take 1/100 of the specified duration. This is used when a pushbutton is held-down for controlling the dimming, and when the dimming is fulfilled from other Z-Wave devices.

A value of 0 is immediately.
Values from 1 - 127 is duration in seconds.
Values from 128 - 255 is duration in minutes (minus 127).

This parameter specifies the duration when turning the light on or off.

A value of 0 is immediately.
Values from 1 - 127 is duration in seconds.
Values from 128 - 255 is duration in minutes (minus 127).

The dimmer can work in three different modes:
- No dimming, only on/off (0/100%)
- leading edge dimming
- trailing edge dimming
This parameter specifies the actual level of the dimmer output when set to 0%.
This parameter specifies the actual level of the dimmer output when set to 99%.
This parameter can be used for disabling Central Scene notifications.
This parameter enables or disables double activation of pushbuttons.
This parameter can be used for disabling the Z-Wave network add/remove process when triple-activating pushbutton 1.
This parameter can be used for enabling the enhanced LED control. See document about MATRIX enhanced LED control.
Pushbutton input debounce time in 0.01 seconds resolution.
Specifies the time that a pushbutton must be activated before it is detected as pressed. Resolution is in 0.01 seconds.
Specifies the time that a pushbutton must have been activated before it is accepted as “held-down”. Resolution is 0.01 seconds.
Global brightness control for red color with intensity from 0 to 255
Global brightness control for green color with intensity from 0 to 255
Global brightness control for blue color with intensity from 0 to 255

label.en: Associations groups, transmission when included secure

hint.en: Association group 2, sent as secure
Association group 3, sent as secure
Association group 4, sent as secure
Association group 5, sent as secure
Association group 6, sent as secure
Association group 7, sent as secure
Association group 8, sent as secure
Association group 9, sent as secure
Association group 10, sent as secure
Association group 11, sent as secure
Association group 12, sent as secure
Association group 13, sent as secure
Association group 14, sent as secure

This parameter specifies the functionality of pushbutton 1. The values are:
- Standard toggle-function, the state is switched between on and off, dimming up and down
- Automatic turn off after the time has expired (staircase lighting function), the time is specified in the next configuration parameter
- Automatic turn on after the time has expired, the time is specified in the next configuration parameter
- Always turn off or dim down . Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send ‘off’ or ‘dim down’ commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 4 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual)
- Always turn on or dim up. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send ‘on’ or ‘dim up’ commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 3 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual)

label.en: Always turn off or dim down
Always turn on or dim up

hint.en: This parameter specifies the time used in previous configuration parameter. This parameter is only applicable if pushbutton 1 funktionality is set to one of the automatic turn off/on time values.

This parameter specifies how received Binary Switch Set commands are handled.
Possible values are:
- Binary Switch Set only controls the pushbutton indicator LEDs, ON/OFF
- Binary Switch Set controls the internal switch status and the pushbutton indicator LEDs
- Binary Switch Set is handled as if the user had activated the pushbutton, including transmission of commands via the association groups

This parameter specifies how the LED indication is controlled.
Possible values are:
- Internal LED control is disabled, only external commands control the indication
- The LED indication follows the switch status
- The LED indication follows the switch status – with inverted functionality
- Same as: The LED indication follows the switch status
- Same as: The LED indication follows the switch status – with inverted functionality
- The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer, ON or OFF
- The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer with inverted functionality, ON or OFF
- The LED indicator is ON for 5 seconds when the pushbutton is activated

This parameter specifies how Command Class Switch Color commands are handled.
Possible values are:
- Direct control; the LED indication shows the received colour immediately, until the pushbutton is activated
- Colour command sets the colour for OFF indication
- Colour command sets the colour for ON indication

This parameter specifies the saturation levels for the red, green and blue LEDs, when ON status is indicated. (Default is the ON-state indicated by a 50% blue colour).
Byte 1: Colour saturation, red.
Byte 2: Colour saturation, green.
Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue.
Byte 4: LED control.
Control red color with intensity from 0 to 255. (Default is 0)
Control green color with intensity from 0 to 255. (Default is 0)
Control blue color with intensity from 0 to 255. (Default is 127)

LED indicator control; see the application note about this parameter. (Default is 0)
Value range from 0 to 255.

This parameter specifies the saturation levels for the red, green and blue LEDs, when OFF status is indicated. (Default is the OFF-state indicated as a low white light on 5%).
Byte 1: Colour saturation, red.
Byte 2: Colour saturation, green.
Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue.
Byte 4: LED control.
Control red color with intensity from 0 to 255. (Default is 47)
Control green color with intensity from 0 to 255. (Default is 47)
Control blue color with intensity from 0 to 255. (Default is 47)

LED indicator control; see the application note about this parameter. (Default is 0)
Value range from 0 to 255.

This parameter specifies the functionality of pushbutton 2. The values are:
- Standard toggle-function, the state is switched between on and off, dimming up and down
- Automatic turn off after the time has expired (staircase lighting function), the time is specified in the next configuration parameter
- Automatic turn on after the time has expired, the time is specified in the next configuration parameter
- Always turn off or dim down . Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send ‘off’ or ‘dim down’ commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 4 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual)
- Always turn on or dim up. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send ‘on’ or ‘dim up’ commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 3 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual)

label.en: Always turn off or dim down
Always turn on or dim up

hint.en: This parameter specifies the time used in previous configuration parameter. This parameter is only applicable if previous parameter has value 1 or 2.

instruction.en: Press the upper left button, or the little switch in the middle of the module (covered by a plastic cover), EXACTLY 3 times to activate inclusion mode in the device.
Press the upper left button, or the little switch in the middle of the module (covered by a plastic cover), EXACTLY 3 times to activate exclusion mode in the device.

hint.en: Lifeline
Sends Basic Report (On/Off) when button #1 is used.
Sends Basic Set (On/Off) when button #1 is used.
Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #1 is used.
Sends Binary Toggle Switch Set when button #1 is used.
Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #1 is used.
Sends Basic Report (On/Off) when button #2 is used.
Sends Basic Set (On/Off) when button #2 is used.
Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #2 is used.
Sends Binary Toggle Switch Set when button #2 is used.
Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #2 is used.
Sends Basic Report (On/Off) when button #3 is used.
Sends Basic Set (On/Off) when button #3 is used.
Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #3 is used.
Sends Binary Toggle Switch Set when button #3 is used.
Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #3 is used.
Sends Basic Report (On/Off) when button #4 is used.
Sends Basic Set (On/Off) when button #4 is used.
Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #4 is used.
Sends Binary Toggle Switch Set when button #4 is used.
Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #4 is used.
Sends Basic Report (On/Off) when button #5 is used.
Sends Basic Set (On/Off) when button #5 is used.
Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #5 is used.
Sends Binary Toggle Switch Set when button #5 is used.
Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #5 is used.
Sends Basic Report (On/Off) when button #6 is used.
Sends Basic Set (On/Off) when button #6 is used.
Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #6 is used.
Sends Binary Toggle Switch Set when button #6 is used.
Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #6 is used.

Select Pair Mode for the upper two buttons (button #1 and #2).
Parameter: 1

label.en: In pair mode; left side is on/up, right side is off/down.

hint.en:
Select Pair Mode for the middle two buttons (button #3 and #4).
Parameter: 2

label.en: In pair mode; left side is on/up, right side is off/down.

hint.en:
Select Pair Mode for the lower two buttons (button #5 and #6).
Parameter: 3

label.en: In pair mode: left side is on/up, right side is off/down

hint.en:
Define which of the buttons controls the built-in relay, or if the relay only will be activated for 0.5 seconds, each time button #1 is used.
Parameter: 10

label.en: Controlled by button #1 or by upper paddle in pair mode. (Default)
Controlled by button #2 or by upper paddle in pair mode.
Controlled by button #3 or by middle paddle in pair mode.
Controlled by button #4 or by middle paddle in pair mode.
Controlled by button #5 or by lower paddle in pair mode.
Controlled by button #6 or by lower paddle in pair mode.
Activated for 1.0 seconds, controlled by button #1 (or by upper paddle in pair mode).

hint.en:
Disable or enable the "Central Scene notification".
Parameter: 11
Default: Enabled (unchecked)

Enable or disable the "House Cleaning Mode", where ZHC5010 is able to send a dimming command to set the level of the lights to 100% by pressing a button twice to associated devices.
If buttons are in "pair mode" (parameters 1, 2 and 3) "House Cleaning Mode" will only be activated by clicking the left button twice.
Parameter: 12
Default: Enabled (unchecked)

Configuration of backlight control.
Parameter: 25

label.en: Backlight is only controlled by Indicator Command Class – commands send to endpoint 0
Backlight is turned on for 5 seconds when a button is pressed. (Default)

hint.en:
Enable or disable that Basic Set commands to the root device will be able to control the backlight.
Parameter: 26

label.en: Basic Set commands to endpoint 0 is forwarded to endpoint 1 (Default).
Basic Set commands to endpoint 0 controls backlight (on/off).

hint.en:
Configure the LED status indication for LED 1
Parameter: 4

label.en: LED indication is disabled (can be controlled by Indicator Command Class commands).
LED indicates status of corresponding button. (Default)
LED indicates inverse status corresponding button.
LED indicates status of corresponding paddle (in pair mode).
LED indicates inverse status of corresponding paddle (in pair mode).
LED indicates the status of the built-in relay.
LED indicates inverse status of built-in relay.
LED show a 5 seconds indication when the corresponding button is pressed.

hint.en:
When single pressing the button, nodes associated to group 6 will be switched between the configured upper and lower switch values.
If "Upper Switch Value" (see below) is set to 255 and an associated device a dimmer supporting this, the dimmer will turn on at the level as when turned off.
Parameter: 13 (byte 1)
Default: enabled.

When single pressing the button for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 6.
Parameter: 13 (byte 2)
Range: 0 - 99 (dim-level), 255 (ON: If the associated device is a dimmer supporting this, the dimmer will turn on at the level as when turned off)
Default: 99%

When single pressing the button for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 6.
Parameter: 13 (byte 3)
Range: 0 - 99 (dim-level), 255 (ON)
Default: 0 % (OFF)

Enable or disable if received commands are relayed to the nodes in the association groups.
Parameter: 19
Default: Enabled.

Basic Report is sent non-secure.
Parameter: 27 (bit 1)
Default: Unchecked (commands sent secure).

Basic Set is sent non-secure.
Parameter: 27 (bit 2)
Default: Unchecked (commands sent secure).

Binary Switch Set is sent non-secure.
Parameter: 27 (bit 3)
Default: Unchecked (commands sent secure).

Binary Toggle Switch Set is sent non-secure.
Parameter: 27 (bit 4)
Default: Unchecked (commands sent secure).

Multilevel Switch commands are sent non-secure.
Parameter: 27 (bit 5)
Default: Unchecked (commands sent secure).

hint.en:
When single pressing the button, nodes associated to group 26 will be switched between the configured upper and lower switch values.
If "Upper Switch Value" (see below) is set to 255 and an associated device a dimmer supporting this, the dimmer will turn on at the level as when turned off.
Parameter: 17 (byte 1)
Default: enabled.

When single pressing the button for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 26.
Parameter: 17 (byte 2)
Range: 0 - 99 (dim-level), 255 (ON: If the associated device is a dimmer supporting this, the dimmer will turn on at the level as when turned off)
Default: 99%

When single pressing the button for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 26.
Parameter: 17 (byte 3)
Range: 0 - 99 (dim-level), 255 (ON)
Default: 0 % (OFF)

Enable or disable if received commands are relayed to the nodes in the association groups.
Parameter: 23
Default: Enabled.

instruction.en: Press the upper left button, or the little switch in the middle of the module (covered by a plastic cover), EXACTLY 3 times to activate inclusion mode in the device.
Press the upper left button, or the little switch in the middle of the module (covered by a plastic cover), EXACTLY 3 times to activate exclusion mode in the device.

hint.en: Lifeline
Sends Basic Report (On/Off) when button #1 is used.
Sends Basic Set (On/Off) when button #1 is used.
Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #1 is used.
Sends Binary Toggle Switch Set when button #1 is used.
Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #1 is used.
Sends Basic Report (On/Off) when button #2 is used.
Sends Basic Set (On/Off) when button #2 is used.
Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #2 is used.
Sends Binary Toggle Switch Set when button #2 is used.
Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #2 is used.
Sends Basic Report (On/Off) when button #3 is used.
Sends Basic Set (On/Off) when button #3 is used.
Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #3 is used.
Sends Binary Toggle Switch Set when button #3 is used.
Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #3 is used.
Sends Basic Report (On/Off) when button #4 is used.
Sends Basic Set (On/Off) when button #4 is used.
Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #4 is used.
Sends Binary Toggle Switch Set when button #4 is used.
Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #4 is used.

Select Pair Mode for the upper two buttons (button #1 and #2).
Parameter: 1

label.en: In pair mode; left side is on/up, right side is off/down.

hint.en:
Select Pair Mode for the lower two buttons (button #3 and #4).
Parameter: 2

label.en: In pair mode: left side is on/up, right side is off/down

hint.en:
Define which of the buttons controls the built-in relay, or if the relay only will be activated for 0.5 seconds, each time button #1 is used.
Parameter: 15

label.en: Controlled by button #1 or by upper paddle in pair mode. (Default)
Controlled by button #2 or by upper paddle in pair mode.
Controlled by button #3 or by lower paddle in pair mode.
Controlled by button #4 or by lower paddle in pair mode.
Activated for 0.5 seconds, controlled by button #1 (or by upper paddle in pair mode).
Activated for 0.5 seconds, controlled by button #2 (or by upper paddle in pair mode).
Activated for 0.5 seconds, controlled by button #3 (or by lower paddle in pair mode).
Activated for 0.5 seconds, controlled by button #4 (or by lower paddle in pair mode).
Follows the state of button #1; button pressed => relay is on, button released => relay is off.
Follows the state of button #2; button pressed => relay is on, button released => relay is off.
Follows the state of button #3; button pressed => relay is on, button released => relay is off.
Follows the state of button #4; button pressed => relay is on, button released => relay is off.
Only controlled by commands sent to the root device.

hint.en:
When ZHC5010 receives an Indicator Set message, the received value can be used as:
 1) Temporary: The current light level for the actual LED will be set, but not stored (the next time the LED is activated the light level will be as set in "LED ON brightness level" (parameters 7-10) or
2) The "LED ON brightness level" for the actual LED (parameters 7-10) will be updated to the received value thereby changing the light level for the actual LED for subsequent internal LED activations.
Parameter: 16

label.en: Indicator Set level values are only used to control the LED (value not stored).
Indicator Set level values are also used by internal LED activations (value stored). (Default)

hint.en:
Configure the scene sequence numbers that will be transmitted by Central Scene notifications: 
Parameter: 17
Range: 0 - 200
0 == Scene notifications are turned off
button #1 will send scene [value],
button #2 will send scene [value] + 1,
button #3 will send scene [value] + 2,
button #4 will send scene [value] + 3.
Default = 1

Enable or disable the "House Cleaning Mode", where ZHC5010 is able to send a dimming command to set the level of the lights to 100% by pressing a button twice to associated devices.
If buttons are in "pair mode" (parameters 1 and 2) "House Cleaning Mode" will only be activated by clicking the left button twice.
Parameter: 18
Default: Enabled (unchecked)

Determine the time interval for which a button needs to be held in to send a "long-pressed command".
Parameter: 28
Range: 1 - 255: Detection time in 0.01 seconds
Default: 50 (= 0.5 seconds).
0: Detection disabled. This is not recommended.
